Title: Katsina declares Friday work-free for Islamic New Year 1447AH
Summary: Friday, June 27, 2025, is a work-free day to mark the beginning of the Islamic New Year, 1447AH . The Katsina State Government has declared Friday June 27 as a work free day .

Title: Walson-Jack urges civil servants to embrace innovation for current challenges
Summary: Head of the Civil Service of the Federation, Mrs Didi Esther Walson-Jack, has charged civil servants to rejuvenate and be innovative to be able to address the challenges of the 21st century . Speaking at the inaugural International Civil Service Conference .

Title: Adamawa police bust tricycle, motorcycle theft syndicate
Summary: Adamawa State Police Command has recorded another major breakthrough in its fight against organised crime . The arrest of a seven-man syndicate involved in the theft and illegal trade of tricycles and motorcycles in Yola metropolis .

Title: NBBF releases D’Tigress preliminary squad for 2025 AfroBasket
Summary: NBBF releases D’Tigress preliminary squad for 2025 FIBA Women’s AfroBasket Championship . The announcement marks the official start of the tournament in Abidjan, Côte d’Ivoire .

Title: Radda dismisses vice presidential ambition rumours
Summary: Katsina State Governor, Dr Dikko Radda, has dismissed rumours about his alleged vice presidential ambition . Dr Dika Raddi stated this during the distribution of bags of grains and cash assistance . He said that his singular focus remains serving the people of the state .

Title: Tinubu rejects NDLEA Amendment Bill
Summary: President Bola Tinubu has declined assent to the National Drug Law Enforcement Agency (NDLEA) Amendment Bill, 2025 . The bill was recently passed by the National Assembly .

Title: Full list: Top scorers at 2025 FIFA Club World Cup
Summary: FIFA Club World Cup 2025 gathers pace in the United States . Argentine winger Ángel Di María has emerged as one of the tournament’s joint-top scorers .

Title: 16 killed, thousands of businesses destroyed after Kenya protests
Summary: There is deep resentment against President William Ruto, who came to power in 2022 promising rapid economic progress . The protests follow a series of violent protests against Ruto's government .

Title: Kebbi Govt releases N422m for students’ registration fees
Summary: Gov. Nasir Idris of Kebbi has released N422.1 million for payment of the payment of students' registration fees of 6,127 students . Gov. Idris said the money will be used to pay for the 2024/2025 academic session registration fees .

Title: Senate confirms Tinubu’s nominees into boards of 4 Rivers agencies
Summary: Senate confirms Tinubu's nominees into boards of 4 Rivers agencies . Confirmation followed presentation of the report on screening by the Committee on Emergency Rule in Rivers .

Summary: The incident occurred late on Wednesday, sending panic to residents in the area and shop owners along the road as the shootings happened “suddenly and in a chaotic manner” The deceased, said to be an inspector, was part of a patrol team conducting routine checks when they intercepted a Toyota Sienna vehicle . Title: NDLEA nabs 127 drug offenders, seizes over 1,205 kg in Bauchi
Summary: The National Drug Law Enforcement Agency, Bauchi State Command, has arrested 127 suspected drug offenders and seized 1,205.174 kilograms of different classes of drugs from January 2025 to date . This was disclosed in a press statement to commemorate the 2025 International Day Against Drug Abuse and Illicit Drug Trafficking, June 26 of every year .

Title: BREAKING: Court sentences Timileyin Ajayi to death for beheading corps member
Summary: The High Court in Lafia, Nasarawa State, has sentenced Oluwatimileyin Ajayi to death by hanging for the gruesome murder of a National Youth Service Corps member, Salome Adaidu . Justice Simon Aboki found him guilty of culpable homicide .

Title: BREAKING: INEC to conduct by-elections August 16
Summary: The elections are being organised to fill vacant seats in the National and State Assemblies . The INEC Chairman, Prof. Mahmood Yakubu, disclosed this during the consultative meeting with political parties in Abuja on Thursday .

Title: Rep donates mobile science labs to Enugu secondary schools
Summary: Enugu North/South Federal Constituency in the House of Representatives, Chimaobi Atu, has taken a significant step towards improving science education in his constituency . The lawmaker’s initiative aims to bridge the gap in science education by providing students with hands-on experience in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics .
